release.action: The COBOL binding XML schema namespace has been changed to reflect modifications in handling of byteLength and value attributes. The new namespace is http://www.legsem.com/legstar/xml/cobol-binding-1.0.1.xsd and it exists at this location.
Pure DBCS fields (PIC G, DISPLAY-1) are now supported properly. They map to Strings (not byte[] anymore).
Fields with VALUE SPACES are no longer initialized with an actual string of spaces.
Fixed issue 26: When 2 complex types from the same COBOL fragment have name conflicts, the schema generator now appends the original source line number to create a unique type name.

The COBOL Schema generator now accepts a jaxbTypeClassesSuffix parameter. The string value passed in this parameter is used to suffix all Complex Type names. There was a default prefix of "Type" in previous versions. It is important to note that this is not the case anymore starting with 1.2.2 (the default for jaxbTypeClassesSuffix is no suffix).
Fixed an issue reported by NWA with certain keywords (TO, IS, ...) that the parser was missing when they were in lowercase.
Does not generate JAXB global bindings anymore. The JAXB COBOL Annotator now comes with an external binding file that does that.

The schema generator now shares model and tasks inherited from codegen with other schema generators. Normalizing ant task properties leads to various deprecated properties. Schema generator also now includes a velocity template for ant script generation in support for the schema generator Eclipse plugin.
First version of the COBOL Structures Mapping Generator.
